video.title: TEDTalks: Global Villages
video.synopsis: Experience cultural immersion and venture into new worlds with these TEDTalks which discuss ethnicity, the politically marginalized and more.

episodes.synopsis: National Geographic Explorer Wade Davis celebrates the amazing diversity of the world's indigenous cultures, which are disappearing at a scary rate.
episodes.title: Wade Davis: Dreams from Endangered Cultures

episodes.synopsis: Anil Gupta is on the hunt for the developing world's unsung inventors -- entrepreneurs whose ingenuity, hidden by poverty, could change many lives.
episodes.title: Anil Gupta: India's Hidden Hotbeds of Invention

episodes.synopsis: Nigerian writer Chris Abani says that "what we know about how to be who we are" comes from stories. He searches for the heart of Africa in its poems.
episodes.title: Chris Abani on the Stories of Africa

episodes.synopsis: Bunker Roy founded the Barefoot College in Rajasthan, India. The school cultivates local solar engineers, artisans and dentists in rural villages.
episodes.title: Bunker Roy: Learning from a Barefoot Movement

episodes.synopsis: In poverty and famine, a boy built a windmill to power his home. Eight years later, William Kamkwamba shares the tale of the life-changing invention.
episodes.title: William Kamkwamba: How I Harnessed the Wind

episodes.synopsis: Photographer Monika Bulaj shares powerful, intimate images of Afghanistan -- of home life, of ritual, of men and of women.
episodes.title: Monika Bulaj: The Hidden Light of Afghanistan

episodes.synopsis: Aaron Huey's effort to photograph poverty in the U.S. led him to the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, where he captured the struggle of native Lakota.
episodes.title: Aaron Huey: America's Native Prisoners of War

episodes.synopsis: Rural villages are being deserted, as billions of people flock to cities to live in teeming squatter camps and slums. "Great," says Stewart Brand.
episodes.title: Stewart Brand: Squatter Cities Are the Future

episodes.synopsis: Nandan Nilekani, the visionary co-founder of outsourcing pioneer Infosys, explains whether India can continue its recent breakneck progress.
episodes.title: Nandan Nilekani's Ideas for India's Future

episodes.synopsis: Photographer Phil Borges shows rarely seen images of people from the mountains of Dharamsala, India, and the jungles of the Ecuadorean Amazon.
episodes.title: Phil Borges on Endangered Cultures

episodes.synopsis: Collector Ravin Agrawal introduces 10 of India's most exciting young contemporary artists. Each artist draws on their local culture for inspiration.
episodes.title: Ravin Agrawal: 10 Young Indian Artists to Watch

episodes.synopsis: In his home of Namibia, John Kasaona protects endangered animal species by giving nearby villagers responsibility for caring for the animals.
episodes.title: John Kasaona: How Poachers Became Caretakers

episodes.synopsis: When an elder dies, it's as if a library is burned. Anthropologist Elizabeth Lindsey collects cultural knowledge passed down as stories and lore.
episodes.title: Elizabeth Lindsey: Curating Humanity's Heritage
